DataElement.preferredName: Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test (MAST) Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A state in the north central United States. Its capital is Lansing._A chronic disease in which a person craves drinks that contain alcohol and is unable to control his or her drinking.  A person with this disease also needs to drink greater amounts to get the same effect and has withdrawal symptoms after stopping alcohol use. Alcoholism affects physical and mental health, and can cause problems with family, friends, and work._The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test (MAST) Substance use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A state in the north central United States. Its capital is Lansing._A chronic disease in which a person craves drinks that contain alcohol and is unable to control his or her drinking.  A person with this disease also needs to drink greater amounts to get the same effect and has withdrawal symptoms after stopping alcohol use. Alcoholism affects physical and mental health, and can cause problems with family, friends, and work._The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._Consumption of medicine, drugs, or other materials including prescription, over-the-counter, or street drugs; alcohol; and tobacco.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Consumption of medicine, drugs, or other materials including prescription, over-the-counter, or street drugs; alcohol; and tobacco.
